title: Introduction to React Hooks
text: React Hooks provide a powerful and flexible way to use state and other React features without writing classes. This article explores useState and useEffect in detail.

title: Building REST APIs with Node.js
text: Node.js is a popular choice for building fast and scalable backends. This article guides you through creating a REST API with Express and MongoDB.

title: Styling in React with SCSS
text: Using SCSS with React allows for more maintainable and scalable stylesheets. This article explains how to set up SCSS in a React project and some best practices.

title: JavaScript ES6 Features
text: ES6 brought many new features to JavaScript, including arrow functions, template literals, and destructuring. This article highlights the most important additions and how to use them.

title: Understanding Asynchronous JavaScript
text: Asynchronous JavaScript can be tricky to understand. This article covers callbacks, promises, and async/await, explaining how to handle asynchronous operations effectively.

title: State Management in React
text: Managing state in large React applications can be challenging. This article compares different state management solutions like Redux, Context API, and Zustand.

title: GraphQL vs REST
text: GraphQL and REST are two popular API design approaches. This article compares their pros and cons, helping you decide which one to use for your next project.
